definition: to leave home to make one's way in the world/to leave the life one knows to seek success
to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
to travel around the country

sentences.english: After that, they were of their own, ready to enter a world with no boundaries.
sentences.chinese: 那以後，他們每個人都要到大千世界裏獨自闖蕩了。

sentences.english: You shouldn't wander about outside all day long, and it's time to get a fixed job.
sentences.chinese: 你不要整天在外面闖蕩，應該有份穩定的工作了。

sentences.english: My father is in my eyes don't understand, make a great river north and south in.
sentences.chinese: 我的父輩就在我的不懂的眼光中，闖蕩在大江南北。

sentences.english: Give me a little courage, let me accompany you along with your far-off regions.
sentences.chinese: 給我一點勇氣，讓我伴你闖蕩，跟你海角天涯。

sentences.english: How many spells risk exploration torrent.
Do you dream of travelling the world and having adventures?
sentences.chinese: 你夢想周遊世界冒險闖蕩嗎？

definition: to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to seek knowledge/to study/to attend college
campaign/expedition
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
foreign land/a place far from home
to teach (in a school)
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
to read/to study
to practice what one preaches (idiom)
to pursue/to track down/to search
to trade/to carry out commercial activities/in business
to learn a skill or art
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to read a book/to study/to attend school
